JobFullDesc:
The Global Premium Benefits team provides thought leadership and decision support to key leaders in Consumer & Global Premium Services and Finance as well as operates as the Global Center of Excellence for Premium Benefits. This is a high visibility role with a focus on some of the most important initiatives in one of the largest segments of American Express. The team partners across functions to support the benefit and global product strategy through business development conversations and an expanding Global Lounge portfolio.
 
Responsibilities:

Manage center of excellence for global lounges across Blue Box
Own decision support for Centurion Lounge portfolio and Lounge partnerships 
Lead analytical and decision support to the Global Benefits team
Develop and maintain strong relationships with business leaders in Marketing, Finance, and other functions
Own and lead the financial analysis of initiatives such as merchant funded value decisions, product refreshes, customer treatment strategies, price and incentive testing
Develop and maintain deep understanding of the competitive environment, and our competitive positioning
Identify and lead analyses that support business decisions that will improve product economics and help leaders move the business forward
Define benchmarks and lead analysis to validate and enhance future modelling
Work cross-functionally to source benchmarks or data for key assumptions; quickly learn relevant information and incorporate into analyses
Support planning and forecasting for enterprise-wide cost of card member services; supporting business transformation and margin enhancements

Qualifications:
 

Bachelor Degree Required; MBA preferred
Excel- advanced (comfortable with pivot tables, vlookups, charts, graphs and financial modeling)
Presentations- must be able to create at a professional level and present to senior management
3+ years direct experience with Financial background
Knowledge of card economics, with emphasis on charge dynamics
Solid financial, analytical, conceptual and problem solving skills
Experience in handling and synthesizing complex information
Motivated self- starter who can operate on multiple, confidential, diverse fronts simultaneously and with careful attention to detail
Flexibility to function in a fast-paced environment and high energy team player
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) with ability to interact at all levels of the organization
Experience with IDN, SQL and/or SAS preferred
